website_summaries.verdict: Though basic, this lightweight, no-frills option will delight music-lovers with its design and functions.
pros: Small, lightweight, waterproof, and easy to use during almost any activity
Great for listening to your favorite tunes while swimming
cons: The sound is not as powerful as some other models
Lacks bells and whistles and doesn't have a lot of storage space

customer_reviews.title: Does the job well enough.
customer_reviews.text: Developing audio products for active lifestyle use is never easy, and these headphones do an ok job: better than a lot of other offerings. However, the ear loops are rather uncomfortable, and it is absolutely essential you wear goggles (when swimming) or a hat/headband (when running) to keep these on your head. Furthermore, the sound delivery is compromised by loose fit, no matter which size bud you use. That said, it works; it does the job; so good "enough".
customer_reviews.author: NW

customer_reviews.title: I REALLY WAS HOPING THIS WAS THE ONE
customer_reviews.text: Sorry....I tried....it's gotta go back. This is the single most inconsistent electronic device I've ever purchased. Used only for bike riding, no water. Once you get the correct size rubber ear plugs adjusted it feels great and I really love the feel of these headphones, but like others said, just a slight nudge and you lose the deep stereo sound. Also as stated in other reviews crackling sound, left side cuts sound in and out, and for some reason it just stopped playing after a certain track. Shuffle mode is on so I don't understand. Maybe it's at the end of my 300 song list, and I now must reinstall all the songs. Not happened.
customer_reviews.author: IanZ

customer_reviews.title: What they should call it is Pyle of Garbage
customer_reviews.text: This thing, let me tell you. First off I couldn't get any of the included ear buds to seal my ears while I swam my laps. I think that is a fault of the way it is designed, at least for me it doesn't sit at the correct angle to my ear canals. I confirmed this buy purchasing some other tips for the ear pieces. It became a constant distraction in the pool. Then of course like clockwork and the other reviews have warned, it gave up after about 4 swims.
customer_reviews.author: LOLFWD

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter to run with. First of all, she has a Mac and although supposedly compatible, it was not and we could not download any music. So, I tried with my PC and it shows it has music downloaded to it, but does not play. We have wasted so much time trying to figure this out, and I’m just done!
customer_reviews.author: M. Ringo

customer_reviews.title: Not for audio books, good for music
customer_reviews.text: Works great for listening in the pool, so light as to be unnoticed, comfortable ear buds and, even though they are small, the control buttons are easy to use without taking it off. Two quibbles though: it requires a special adapter in order to transfer files onto the player so don't lose it ( which is what happened to me on another player I had) and it doesn't play the tracks in order so is totally useless for an audiobook. Not only that but it starts at the beginning of each chapter / track. I'd actually return it except that it's not worth the money because the only thing I wanted it for was the audio books.
customer_reviews.author: Callie Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable, don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: I ended up with two of these. The first stopped working after about 5 uses. I returned it (I had to pay to send it back) and a replacement was sent as the first was deemed defective. The second unit only played the same 10-15 songs even though there were about 50-70 uploaded on the unit (all of the same itunes format). The music quality was fine (for a pool) and it was great to have for 1000+ yard drills. That unit died in the pool after about a month and a half. Now it will not charge or play anything. I'm not going to bother sending it back only to go through this process again.
customer_reviews.author: Tara Culliton

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money - tried two different pairs - same story
customer_reviews.text: After trying these TWICE they only last 3-4 swims. (45 min each) The first pair stopped working - Amazon was great getting me a replacement. The second set - same story after three uses - lost hearing on one side... Tried their troubleshooting - reaching out to their tech... Unfortunately too late for me to claim the return w/ Amazon so complete waste of money. So sad as I really wanted these to work. And the suffle function did not work at all even on the first use. I wish I had read the negative reviews. Off to looking for something better. Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: Sound is better underwater
customer_reviews.text: I was initially underwhelmed by these, but I put my head under the water while water walking for PT and said holy crap. I suppose the engineers had in mind that the dead sound of the water, and the sound resonating in your ears, would work well. And I'm working out underwater and still able to listen to music. They're a bit awkward to wear until you fuss with the band / adjust your swim goggles to accommodate another loop around the back of your head. Getting the shuffle function to work on the fly (i.e. middle of a workout when you have 1/2 second to breath) is a little difficult.
customer_reviews.author: David M. Madden

customer_reviews.title: Just don't bother
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality: sounds like a colony of bees singing ariana grande Build quality: flimsy, cheap plastic, the neck wrap around piece actually makes it harder to use and "swim headphones" is a stretch. I was able to wear them for 10 minutes before the right ear completely stopped playing sound. Not to mention the ear pieces would never stay in. Comfort: Unwearable, the earloops pushed on my ears and pulled the ear piece out constantly. Digs into the cartalidge and chaffs the back of my ear which is not okay. You need to spend more money to get usable swimming headphones. $100 atleast
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: UNHAPPY PURCHASER FOR SURE!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely can not get this MP3 to download from my laptop. I am so frustrated!!!! I emailed Plye.com directly and have never gotten a call or email from them. It does not come with instructions that indicate how to download from your music library. After speaking with my IT guy at my office he informed me that this company is LOW END when it comes to electronics. He told me that with the response I am getting when I plug in the USB more than likely the piece is broken. Unfortunately I need to contact my credit card company to get information as how to return it. NOT HAPPY!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to add music to
customer_reviews.text: Easy to add music to, easy to charge, and boy are they loud. Yes you can adjust the volume. Ive yet to try them underwater but the waterproof tips are included. My only regret is it would be nice if you didn't have to change out the tips for water use and land use. I'm currently using them for running and the gym so I'm not having to carry my smart phone along with me during my workouts. If your not using an app for working out and just like to hear music and like to go to the beach, than yes this product is for you.
customer_reviews.author: Paul M. Plasencia

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable. It's more like a trouble maker than a stress reliever
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes, it doesn't turn ON. Other times, you leave it charging and it doesn't charge. Now, the battery is not lasting my 40min session anymore. Is it not charging? Is it a bad battery? Who knows. The second unit I tried, died after less than two months. It's not worth the troubleshooting. I'm looking for something more reliable. I'm done with Pyle.
customer_reviews.author: Fern

customer_reviews.title: tunes while swimming, totally waterproof
customer_reviews.text: I love these for swimming. The sound comes and goes sometimes with swim cap movement but I love having tunes for swimming. It is very easy to charge (just don't loose that charger because it is specific to the device and don't know how you would replace it). You use the same cord to put music on and it is very easy to load. I lost a swim earbud immediately and their product support helped me get a replacement, in fact the pack they found for me has 4 pair so I should be set for awhile.
customer_reviews.author: Katie1554

customer_reviews.title: Charger is flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Update: The charger no longer connects. The connection is so flimsy that it can't mount on my desktop any longer, so I can't copy my audiobook files. A shame because ergonomically they are the best ones yet. I gave it 5 stars initially. Now just one. Sorry. This is the second pair of Pyles I've owned, and they're even better than the first ones. I swim laps pretty rigorously 2 hours a week and listen to audiobooks. The earpieces are snugger than anything else so far, and so is the sound clarity. I've tried cheap $20 Chinese players, waterproofed iPods, similar J-Lab 'phones, and waterproof pouches for iPod. Pyle is by far the best, and a great value too.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Works, perfect as a standalone player
customer_reviews.text: You can load music on this MP3 player and play it for hours before needing a charge. The charger clip itself is a little weird, but I can live with it. I use this on short swims too. Just make sure you dry it off when you get out of the pool. I use them to run sometimes too, or at the gym. I have mine on shuffle, so each time I press the buttons forward or back I get a new song. No wires, no bluetooth, no problems. This is the perfect music player if you just want to shut out everything while you do your sets.
customer_reviews.author: My Review

customer_reviews.title: Great for swimming laps!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and was ready to be disappointed. Well, I love these earbuds! They are super easy to transfer mp3 songs to and have been very pleased so far! I swim laps 3x a week and it can get boring. A couple of things to keep in mind. I use these for complete underwater listening, so sound quality is already compromised but, I hear my songs and they help me keep pace. I can’t push off the wall too hard or they will come out. But for providing entertainment and pacing. I am so happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie B

customer_reviews.title: Works like a dream!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these so that I could listen to music and podcasts while I swim laps If you have the right size ear buds on them, I couldnt hear any difference in the volume from under water. It was a little difficult for me to figure out that the files I was trying to download needed to be converted into MP3 files and then how to do that and download (for files not already mp3, I used iTunes to convert them) but now that I've figured it out, it's super easy! I love my headphones!
customer_reviews.author: Breanna Groneman

customer_reviews.title: Good for swimming.
customer_reviews.text: I bouht these to replace the 2013 model, which had finally died after 5 years of use. Honestly I kind of miss the design on the others, as they fit my ears a bit better. But these have much better battery life and are easier to charge. I think I need to try some different earbud bits though because water gets into one of my ears. When it does, it's hard to hear out of that side until it drys out. But they are plenty durrable in the water, and I love how they make me work out longer.
customer_reviews.author: Luna

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I use these daily when I go to the pool to do my aquatic exercises. The water does not seem to be a problem at all. The sound quality is amazing. I find it very easy to use the controls to adjust the volume, etc. I had 2 other swim headphones in the past and these are so much better. In fact, my husband tried mine and ending up buying a pair for himself. It has made a big difference in my enjoyment while exercising.
customer_reviews.author: jacksmom

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Product.
customer_reviews.text: These Are A Step Up From Tha First Generation Pyle Mp3 Player, as Related To Smoothness Of Operation. I Wish That The Ear Insert Portion Of The Headphones Were Adjustible Instead Of In A Set Position. Everyone's Ears Are Different, and I Found Them To Be Uncomfortable Initially. I Purchased Some 3Layer Earbuds, and They Feel Much Better. I Do Prefer The Style Of Tha Frame Of The 1st Generation, because The Curves The look More Stylish. The 2nd Generation Frame Is To Circular and Bland For My Taste. I Also Wish They Came In All Black. Sound Quality Is Stellar Though. Great Product So Far.
customer_reviews.author: Jedi

customer_reviews.title: DOESN'T WORK FOR FLIP TURN & SOUND QUALITY NOT GOOD
customer_reviews.text: This is a gimmick. It's water proof and works, but if you do flip turn, they won't stay. I pressed hard and secure in my ear, but still water gets in a little and I can't hear anything. I had to stop and remove the water all the time. This doesn't work and I ended up buying SYRYN water proof MP3 player. SYRYN has over 1000 reviews and I've learned a lesson. Just go with what most people buy and with good reviews. Don't waste money on this.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for swimming
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical when I purchased this as reviews have varied, but so far I love it. I swim laps and the sound quality is great and the charges lasts longer than any I've ever purchased. At first I was a little worried because the fit isn't tight & didn't feel "secure" but the earbuds have never come out & the headset has never slipped. It's what I wanted --works, long battery, I don't have to worry about slippage while I'm swimming & the sound is clear and loud.
customer_reviews.author: susan smithhisler

customer_reviews.title: I am constantly asked where I got these excellent headphones made for swimming
customer_reviews.text: I am constantly asked where I got these excellent headphones made for swimming. While the left or right ear phone may go out, a quick reset of clearing the sound channel fixes the headphones. I love wearing them, listening to music while swimming my mile several times a week. 40 minutes is better with tunes. I recommend for the recreational or competitive swimmer who swims more than a few laps at a time..after 1 month of use the system has cut out over and over. Sometimes just repeats the same song. Have reset it multiple times. The return process is a pain. But good while it lasted.
customer_reviews.author: GPB

customer_reviews.title: Good value for a waterproof set of headphones with built in music storage
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Good value for a waterproof set of headphones with built in music storage. My one complaint is there's no simple way to section of the music in the hard drive. I've got 200 workout songs but would also like to add books on tape. Other hitting the forward button hundreds of times, there's no way to just jump from one type of file for the others. Thus the phones are really only good for one type of sound file and use. Still, a solid solution that gas held up well.
customer_reviews.author: Silas

customer_reviews.title: Great for swimming laps!
customer_reviews.text: Pretty decent sound for the cost. I only wish the player accepted AAC file format songs from iTunes so I didn't have to convert the music in my library to load onto the player, but once I got used to the process it went fairly quickly. Holds lots of tunes. Used them for the first time today while swimming laps! What a game changer! No more boring laps! I didn't want to get out of the water. Swam more laps than usual (90 laps-1 1/2 hrs) and it seemed effortless. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: DW

customer_reviews.title: waterproof for swimming
customer_reviews.text: This is the second or third one of these I have purchased, the last one lasted 2 years and is still going, they are the best waterproof music player out on the market. I swim for exercise and I can tell you I swim twice as much because I have the tunes going, they are light weight and don't bounce around when you are running and you can go straight from the gym into the pool with them. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: greg Saunders

customer_reviews.title: Love these for swimming laps!
customer_reviews.text: I was initially thinking I wanted bluetooth earbuds but many of the reviews mentioned the sound cutting out. It got these at a great price, worth risking if I didn't like them and the sound is great and consistent. I swim laps for 35 minutes every day and have them on for at least 10 minutes earlier skimming, and the battery life is fine for that. I charge them the next day so I'm not really sure how long they would go if I left them on longer. It's a real treat to be able to swim and hear my favorite songs at the same time!
customer_reviews.author: M. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Broken out of the box, pay to have it repaired!
customer_reviews.text: I used this product for the first time today, greater than 30 days after I ordered it. The right side earpiece did not work from the beginning. Sound Around (aka Pyle USA Warranty) wants me to pay to ship their defective product to them; then pay to have my either-fixed-or-replaced product to be shipped back to me. Shipping is going to cost almost half the cost of purchasing! Their idea of a cost free warranty claim is returning the product back to Amazon. Once you're past 30 days, you're out of luck! Save yourself the headache and don't even bother with this product. I'm going to chalk this up as a loss.
customer_reviews.author: damien fink

customer_reviews.title: die after 20-30 uses without fail
customer_reviews.text: I have used 3 new pairs of these so far. They inevitably fail after a few months. But I like the angle of the earplugs and how they stay in the ear, so for the cost (if they are in the $30 range) they might be worth it, as a disposable device. So far customer service is expensive to deal with ($ to send and receive the device) and not helpful -- they do not want to replace a device that went out of warranty DURING the COVID lock-down, when i could not mail it back. So not a fan of customer service so far.
customer_reviews.author: A Baylouny

customer_reviews.title: Not satisfied. Four days and its a bust
customer_reviews.text: Not satisfied. On the fourth swim and day I had these the right speaker went out. I hear very faint sounds to no sound at all. Also, when I change the music the sounds change any direction regardless of the button I'm pushing. Five min later I'm back at the song I was trying to get to with one push of the button.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa koth

customer_reviews.title: This has never worked properly. It wouldn't turn on ...
customer_reviews.text: This has never worked properly. It wouldn't turn on. Managed to get it to turn on, but that was the last time. Wishing I had paid closer attention to when the 30 days was up for returning. I would have returned it and gotten something else. It's a piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Kelley C. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work for swimming
customer_reviews.text: First use: volume went up and down immediately. Instructions say it's due to a water film over the ear buds, fine, except that apparently kept happening nonstop as I swam. I spent so long wrangling the headphones I ended up losing an ear bud and cut down my laps. I'll be returning these for a much more effortless finis one. This one is relatively easy to charge and load songs. But i don't recommend for swimming.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: ReDo on rating because of charging issue
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these for 2 months swimming laps with no issue until now. The charging was never user friendly when as there is no indication on when fully charged. Well, for two days they did not turn on. They do/may work now but because of the charging issue they do become unreliable. Emailed company but no response so probably will order another brand.
customer_reviews.author: MARK

customer_reviews.title: Fixed!
customer_reviews.text: After several hours I figured it out. You MUST make sure the files are .wma. You can NOT use windows media player. You MUST open and drop the files onto the player. THEN it will work. Hurray!
customer_reviews.author: Thea Frohlich

customer_reviews.title: Best fit headphone but it dies.
customer_reviews.text: Good fit without any wire design. All other swimming players that you need to tuck in your goggle are really stressful to manage before swimming. I have to give credits to this company who designed this. However, like other comments mentioned, it dies. Im a daily swimmer, around 20 min per day, and it died after 5 months. Just like other comment says, should i go for other high-end like Sony? or go another one to admit that it is part of my living cost to maintain my health... im still holding my decision though
customer_reviews.author: Kiichi

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: Having tried about half-a-dozen portable MP3 players, this one is by far the best. Even though it can reportedly work for swimmers, which I never tried, its performance for runners and other workouts is superb. The following advantages are worth mentioning: 1) gentle, yet close contact with ears and excellent stability allowing any type of workouts; 2) no complications due to sweating; 3) a simple file structure: just one folder, very robust, multiple file structures tested all worked fine; 4) simple robust button design excluding undesired mechanical perturbations and unwanted interruptions due to random movements. Being so much impressed, I have then bought the same for my mom, wife, and a couple of friends as present -- excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Victor Karpov

customer_reviews.title: Like to listen to books on my daily kayaking trips
customer_reviews.text: Love this products as I like to listen to books on my daily 2-3 hour kayaking trips into the bay. Winds and waves sometimes make it difficult to hear but these things are amazing and have a very clear (and loud if needed) sound. Files are played in alphabetical orders so downloaded books work well when files are named appropriately. Also do not have to worry about salt water or rain bothering them. And no loose wires to get in the way! Life is good....
customer_reviews.author: VPitt

customer_reviews.title: Okay, but could be way better.
customer_reviews.text: My wife really wanted a pair of water proof headphones for swimming. These seemed like the would work great but unfortunately there have been some issues. While they work great in and under water, they are not adjustable in anyway. They do come with different sized ear bud adapters but there is no way to adjust for different head sizes. They fit me fine, but are much to large for my wife, and she has a difficult time keeping them on while she is swimming which defeats the purpose of having them.
customer_reviews.author: El-Dave-O

customer_reviews.title: Great for people on the spectrum!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my son who has autism. I had tried four other pair before we heard of these. They are awesome! They cancel out noise well and even play calming music if he would like. The waterproof factor is an added bonus. He used them at a water park and said it was very nice to have the option. Worth every penny! They can hold a lot of music, too. I put a sound escape that is well over two hours and it still has room for more.
customer_reviews.author: Ms girl

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect but pretty good
customer_reviews.text: I've used these headphones for several days, mostly for running. Here's what I think... The good: they are loud, and do a pretty good job of canceling out any sound around you. The quality isn't superb but not bad for the price, and is in no way distracting. Also, they charge pretty fast - a 10 minute charge got me an hour's worth of music and still going! The bad: my only complaint is that it isn't obvious when you turn them on or off. I just wish there was some small beep that played when turning them off so I know they are actually off. *Note, I have not tried swimming in these yet, will update when I do
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Scrambles tracks of my books
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this after using the Jlab Go for years. I really like that product, but the hinges snap where the headphone piece connects to the neckband. This looks like a cleaner design. I purchased this to listen to books. However, when I drag and drop the file, the device reorders the tracks. It is not in shuffle mode. I called the company and they said there was no way to keep the tracks in order, which really doesn't make sense to me. This doesn't work for me so , back it goes.
customer_reviews.author: K McB

customer_reviews.title: This is the best product in this category based on value
customer_reviews.text: This is the best product in this category based on value. I tried other "swimming" headphones and they did not work when submerged. These work. The sound quality is excellent. They easily would have earned 5 stars but when you use the appropriate ear plugs for the pool, the sound is muffled and cannot be played loudly enough to rock out. This is an acceptable compromise for having musical accompaniment while swimming laps. You will greatly enjoy these headphones, just know that the max volume in the pool will be less than on land.
customer_reviews.author: Edouble

customer_reviews.title: Jammin' tunes for working out in the pool
customer_reviews.text: Getting your music into these MP3 earbuds is easy enough--it's Itunes that makes it hard, not this product. Anyways I got my music uploaded and they work well enough. I use them for swimming and it isn't a concern that they aren't super high fidelity. After all, your head is UNDERWATER half the time!
customer_reviews.author: FYHIII

customer_reviews.title: I really wanted yo like them
customer_reviews.text: The water keeps coming in after only a few swimming laps. When there is no water it is great to listen to my music while swimming, however, the earplugs do not seal properly, inspite of using the larger ones on very small ears, hence end up not enjoying the music as they sound goes off as soon as there is a leak.
customer_reviews.author: María Luisa

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for the price.
customer_reviews.text: These are an excellent aid to swimming laps. The fit is comfortable as well as works very well underwater. The only issue is that they are not very loud, even at max volume. They also seems to skip songs randomly, once in a while. Other than that, for the price they are a heck of a good deal!
customer_reviews.author: Shori Gerardot

customer_reviews.title: Good buy overall.
customer_reviews.text: Good battery life, comfortable and durable. The sound quality is good too, which is very important. The storage capacity is good enough. The only issue is that sometimes one of the ear pieces won’t work, or there is a discrepancy in the sound quality between the two ear pieces, which can be annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Solid product, good price...if it doesn't break
customer_reviews.text: I've had 4 Pyle waterproof MP3 players in the last ~6 years. The first one lasted 3 years before I accidentally broke the hinge. The second one lasted another 3 years before it stopped turning on & charging. The third (newest model) suddenly stopped working after 3 months and Amazon issued a replacement. The replacement broke within a year with melted charging contacts and I suspect a bulging lithium battery. Roll the dice on reliability.
customer_reviews.author: DHollEE

customer_reviews.title: Great Swimming headphones
customer_reviews.text: Great swimming headphones. I love wearing them for laps. Not very good for running or dry land activity. That's why only 4 stars on sound. Highly recommend these headphones! Update: My pair mysteriously died. No idea why. Contacted customer support and got great support and since my product was under a year old I was sent a new pair of headphones to replace the originals. Great company and great product. And Thank you to Joe in customer support.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Swimming with Podcasts at last!
customer_reviews.text: This is the first pair of swimming earbuds i've owned and I'm basically sold in this new venture. The sound quality is good and definitely rivals other (land) headphones in this price range. Even better, the quality in water is the same! Only thing that happens every now and then is water leaking into an earbud which muffles the sound. You just have to take it off and blow it after and you're good to go though. Finally swimming for exercise got more interesting!
customer_reviews.author: Micah Tatum

customer_reviews.title: Great to use in the pool when you're exercising
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd Pyle MP3 player I've purchased, I keep losing my mp3 player headphones hence the need to buy others. They work great for exercising in the pool and are easy to to operate. I recommend these waterproof mp3 headphones and will buy again if I lose these (:
customer_reviews.author: lmorrow2012

customer_reviews.title: Muffled in one ear constantly
customer_reviews.text: Im not sure. Sound seems to only be in one ear. Once you start swimming sound starys to muffle and be toned out. Maybe i just got a rotten pair. Not sure ill prob send back and try another brand. Before the pool i ran in tredmill and they seem to work fiine.
customer_reviews.author: will

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly for what I need!
customer_reviews.text: I use these to swim 4-5 times a week, and only charge them every couple weeks when I remember. I have never had an issue with them dying or with sound quality under water. The only problem i have with them is having trouble changing between shuffle and normal play. But I also dont know if normal play through would go by song, artist, or album, so i could be correctly switching between modes and not know.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Glenn

customer_reviews.title: I am satisfied with this device with one exception
customer_reviews.text: I am not an audiophile so I cannot meaningfully comment on the sound quality. However, to my ear the sound quality is fine. And the buttons are easy to operate for on/off, volume, and shuffle. I suspect the device has more options than I have learned about. I find it easy on my Mac to click and drag the mp3s into the device. I have not used the player underwater...I simply use it when I swim atop the water. My only "negative" is that I keep getting error messages saying that the device was not "properly ejected" even while I am not making any effort to eject.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: only worked 6 times
customer_reviews.text: Although hard to get to figure out in the beginning, it worked wonderfully for 6 times (less than a month of actual working, but had purchased it a month earlier). Then quit working the 7th time,not recognized by computer, power won't shut off. Now a piece of junk. Customer service is poor, require you to pay shipping to have it fixed. Shipping is almost half the cost of the product. I am going to throw it away and get an Apple product that I know the company will stand behind
customer_reviews.author: Linda Sloat

customer_reviews.title: Systemic Issue known by OEM - Poor logisitcs and supply chain lead to Unit NOT HOLDING A CHARGE.
customer_reviews.text: While the design is sound and I liked the unit while it worked, it does not hold a charge. Contacted OEM (Pyle Audio - (888) 318-7953) and they communicated that the units had sat too long in the warehouse and the battery is now defective. This has been a waste of my time. I will not buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Carroll

customer_reviews.title: It's Okay for the price if it works
customer_reviews.text: It worked fine for 3 times in the pool, broke after 3 uses. Maybe I got a defective. Not impress with the sound quality. Battery life is good, I got it running for 4-5 hours and still going, if not suddenly stop working.
customer_reviews.author: J.Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this product
customer_reviews.text: Last November I bought this product to swim once or twice a week, but it never worked properly, inside the water , it did not stay inside the ears, it skip the tracks without reason, and after several minutes it turn off, finally, from last week, the battery does not charge, now it is completely dead, I ended up losing my money in something that never worked as advertised here on Amazon. It does not work in the water to swim. Do not buy it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 1.5 years and still ticking
customer_reviews.text: Have used a lot in my salt pool. I convert itunes/apple and setup an MP3 folder of my favorites on my hard drive. Then I transfer my preferred tracks to the headset before my workout. Has held up great, good battery life and the sound is suitable for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: MICHAEL

customer_reviews.title: The best headphones for running.
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of running long distances, and have tried many headphones. But these are perfect. You just load (drag and drop) music (mp3 files) onto them from your computer and enjoy your music while running. No phone or dangling wires needed. The control buttons (power volume up and down) are easy to control even with fat fingers. If you get tired of listening to music, you just let this set on your neck without worrying about it falling off and to the ground (like all the others), especially when running and bouncing around, they stay on firmly.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Gregoire

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I bought the headphone for swimming and have been using it for nearly a month. Last week, the headphone stopped being recognized by my laptop. Today, the right side has broken and the left has barely noticeable noise. 1/10 not recommend. I suggest buying a more reputable product if you want the headphone to last but if you want an experience of listening to music underwater, you can try your luck.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do not be fool.
customer_reviews.text: The product works well for about two months then the left speaker will stop working and eventually they entire headset will stop working. Because of the price, I have bought three (3) different pair of the headphones and each one has done the exact same thing. I purchased the warranty along with the last headphone set but contacting the company has not been successful. I have sent emails via the Amazon site and and no return emails or return calls. There are better products on the market. Thank you, 100mile_Swimmer
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works but barely
customer_reviews.text: I've used it twice now for swimming laps. The volume gets too low to hear above the bubbles. Also each time one ear lost volume completely - first time it was the right and second time it was the left. Worked fine after drying but once swimming laps again it will cut out. Not worth the money I spent on it.
customer_reviews.author: yantronica

customer_reviews.title: They work great! I've tried other products and paid loads of ...
customer_reviews.text: They work great! I've tried other products and paid loads of money for other water proof earphones but they always work the same. But with these, they stay in my ear almost perfectly. The only downfall is that if I dive under a little too hard one or both of them will pop out from the force and it'll cause water to get into the ear bud. doesn't cause them to stop working just have to dry them out in the sauna for about 10-15 minutes. Aside from that I'm pretty satisfied. I'll give them a few more week and if anything happens then I'll change my review but if not then It'll remain the same.
customer_reviews.author: Dwight Welsh

customer_reviews.title: I look forward to my early swims because of my MP3 player
customer_reviews.text: I have had this MP3 player for about 6 months now. The battery lasts all week and I charge it up during the weekend but it only takes about an hour. I used iTunes to change my music files to MP3 files and put them on the player. Because I have a mixture of old and new mp3's some songs are (recorded) too loud and sometimes distort but, for the most part, I love this item. Very inexpensive and works as described. Sometimes, the rubber ear pieces fall off and I purchased more but I have not lost the originals yet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for swimming
customer_reviews.text: Have been using these for several swim sessions. they work perfectly for me. Decent sound, HUGE storage capacity, easy to charge and easy to load mp3 files. I'm buying another one as a backup, since I suspect they will not have an indefinite life!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not sure I would purchase again.
customer_reviews.text: It is, so far, waterproof, as advertised. . Which is the key word I was looking for, when looking for this item. It has the ease of use, charging, loading/unloading music to the devise as advertised. What is is missing is low end. Bass response is pretty much negligible. Based on the poor sound quality, I would not purchase this item again, nor would I recommend this item to anyone. Your mileage may vary.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Ricketts

customer_reviews.title: Not what I was hoping for
customer_reviews.text: I knew these were not going to be the best quality, but the sound quality is very poor. When your head is underwater it is a little better, but when your ears are out of the water you can't hear any music. I've tried adjusting and changing out the ear plugs to different sizes but can't get it to work properly. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: happy sound
customer_reviews.text: love it!. have loaded lots of music with more space for more music. It fits well and stays while exercising. I would definitely recommended this. and would buy another one again. you hear music very well. good sound and earplugs stay securely and blocks most of noise from outside. Well, this is my opinion. I am very happy with my purchase, especially I use for gym and when traveling on city buses. please do not use in secluded areas, as you can not hear noises nearby.
customer_reviews.author: ellieNY

customer_reviews.title: falls off
customer_reviews.text: it falls off in open water swimming due to current knocking it off ears and if you put it under swim cap, that works okay, except it's not quite long enough to fit in ears comfortably and it hurts inner ear after a while.
customer_reviews.author: @SarahLucero

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Ok so I’ve had these for a full year. And they work fine in the beginning, I swim a mile once a week. Around 9 months the charging was really hard to get it to connect and by 12 months they just won’t take a charge any more. So I mean I guess I hit what I paid for. But even besides that issue the ear buds come off soooo easy. One ironically came off and got stuck in my ear canal in the middle of a freaking triathalon and I needed a medic to get it out with a tweezer. Also the wire is annoyingly stiff with a swim cap.
customer_reviews.author: Heather OD

customer_reviews.title: This makes them basically useless as I could have just as easily used cheap ...
customer_reviews.text: These headphones worked for about three swims, then the battery went dead. They stay charged for about 10 minutes then they turn off. This makes them basically useless as I could have just as easily used cheap earplugs instead of an expensive pair of headphones that deteriorated after two weeks. Don't buy them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is 2 months shy of a year and I ...
customer_reviews.text: This is 2 months shy of a year and I have not used this mp3 up to 10times and it is just dead. I was swimming listening to music and it just stopped left it for a few days for battery to run down if that was the issue. then put it to charge light came on and then 4 hrs later no light no sound it just does nothing. If the seller reads this pls advise if I have a manufacturers warranty so I can send it bck. I lterally have not used this thing and it is now dead.
customer_reviews.author: kemi Oyefeso

customer_reviews.title: From love to hate
customer_reviews.text: I do not recommend buy this product. I know, it looks cool and probably you are going to see as great product at first. The problem is, if you lost or broke your usb cable you are done, the replacement is about $19, what the heck it is just a cable, I also have the previous version and it has the same problem, generic cables won't transfer data, just charge the device. I used to change my audio files almost once a week, now I have a useless product.
customer_reviews.author: Ernesto Guevara

customer_reviews.title: Great for lap swims and sound isolation is significant.
customer_reviews.text: For activities of lap swims (especially), track running, reading and relaxing (individual sports/activities where cutting out ambient sound does not affect safety), the features and quality of this unit cannot be beat at the price of $40. To note, the sound isolation is significant. I use this unit for lap swims which activity is no more than one hour for three to four times a week. I am not an audiophile, but simply this unit works to my satisfaction
customer_reviews.author: Hanako

customer_reviews.title: Great solution to a touy&
customer_reviews.text: The miles in the pool just slide by! Converting my music to MP3 format was somewhat tedious but doable, find a free conversion website and off you go. Make sure you use your swim goggles to keep the ear buds in place. If you do get water in the them just hold the earpiece upside down and flick it with your finger, the water comes out and you're back in business. Nothing else comes close in this price range.
customer_reviews.author: Connor Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't turn on after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in March and it stopped working in Sept. I could not turn it on but it would take a charge. Looked at the 1 year warranty info and I have to pay for shipping plus $10 and it's at their discretion if I get a repair. The headset cost less than $40 so I rather buy another instead of wasting time. When it worked it was great and I have another Pyle product for years that has never died.
customer_reviews.author: eagle

customer_reviews.title: Ok sound, comfortable fit
customer_reviews.text: Pros- comfortable fit - flat string between earpieces stronger than seems. Easy to teach multifunction button( the reb circle) Cons- not great sound quality - sounded staticky on deep base in pop songs. Right side only- Wish it had Left side controls. Plus cute case and actual instructions included. See photos for details. Note. Just received today and tried it out for 3 songs.
customer_reviews.author: LF

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with purchase
customer_reviews.text: Love this. Learning curve of changing music to MP3’s, but that’s just me. Wanted to try headphones for swimming, but didn’t want to spend a lot. Very happy with purchase. Using 3 or 4 times a week
customer_reviews.author: Jr183

customer_reviews.title: Can’t use for podcasts or audio books
customer_reviews.text: I won’t repeat the other issues people have already posted about these headphones. But my main problem I haven’t seen mentioned here: Every time you turn off the player and turn it on again, it starts the track off at the beginning. This makes it completely useless for anything but listening to music.
customer_reviews.author: Marc Femenella

customer_reviews.title: Great for Swimming
customer_reviews.text: I waited a long time to review this since some of the ones I read on here said it didn't last long. I used mine three to four times a week, swimming: crawl, backstroke and breaststroke, and it works perfectly every time.
customer_reviews.author: Tami L. Parrington

customer_reviews.title: When I first received the unit, for the most ...
customer_reviews.text: When I first received the unit, for the most part it worked except that the buttons to move to the next song or the previous song worked to switch the song, but there was no returning to a previous song. Pushing either button resulted in a new song somewhere on the list. Now, after 7 months of being somewhat irritated about that but not sufficiently motivated to return it, the unit stopped working. It seems to charge when I put it on the charger (light pulses for a while, then goes steady), but I can't get it to turn on any more. I've had it only 7 months and never used it in the water.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Johnson

customer_reviews.title: I love the sound quality
customer_reviews.text: I love these for swimming. The sound comes and goes sometimes with swim cap movement but I love having tunes for swimming. It is very easy to charge (just don't loose that charger because it is specific to the device and don't know how you would replace it). You use the same cord to put music on and it is very easy to load. I lost a swim earbud immediately and their product support helped me get a replacement, in fact the pack they found for me has 4 pair so I should be set for awhile.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly well before it stopped working after 3 months in use.
customer_reviews.text: The product did not last for long. Bought the product this year in May 2018 and by August 2018, the headphones are dead .....not working. I used to use them 5 days in a week ,swimming for max 45 minutes and worked perfectly well. One con about it, it did not fit welll in my ears . Kept coming off and also one side of the ear phones was always having lower sound .
customer_reviews.author: Mes Ochieng

customer_reviews.title: As good as it gets but is it enough?
customer_reviews.text: Finding reasonable inexpensive waterproof headphones is the challenge for the ages. The clamp will stop working about 3 months in. But that’s the case for ANY water proof headphones. It last like 8 hours and and holds hundreds of songs for shuffle play only and it doesn’t play ALL songs. Just most. Anyway. After a while they ended up in a dead pile with all of my other water proof headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: very reliable and good
customer_reviews.text: Very reliable and great sound quality. I swim a mile 3x a week. Not had good luck with earbuds for swimming, but this Pyle Flextreme is very very good. pleasantly surprised. much better than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: C. Krcha

customer_reviews.title: Be careful with that USB cable
customer_reviews.text: The headphones arrived as promised, in working order and in a timely fashion. But after only a couple of uses, the casing on the cord of the USB charging/data transfer cable split in two places, exposing wires inside, and now I can't charge the headphones or connect them to my computer. I just ordered a replacement cable, so hopefully I'll be able to keep using the headphones. The seller didn't do anything wrong. Just not thrilled that an integral piece of the equipment busted within a week of me receiving it.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel D.

customer_reviews.title: Not meant to last
customer_reviews.text: Worked for about 6months, used them regularly (3 days a week) for about 2 months, then one ear the sound went out, stopped using them for 3 months due to covid, tried to use them again and the sound was extremely muffled and distorted. I would have been fine with them if it happened with continued use, but literally used them for two months, and basically broke.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus

customer_reviews.title: Pyle PSWP6BK is an excellent wireless MP3 player!
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased the Pyle PSWP6BK wireless wrap around MP3 player. It was easy to setup and use and comfortable to wear as well. The unit that arrived was brand new and immediately charged up without issue. I was able to load MP3's without any problems and after testing the unit it played the songs as advertised! This is perfect for working out without wires getting in the way. Th wrap around style is both comfortable and stylish. A great product for much cheaper than a Sony.
customer_reviews.author: John M Gomer

customer_reviews.title: The warranty is going to ask for a review and a amazon review plus email address
customer_reviews.text: I broke 6 dozen iphones with head phones because none of them were water proof, I purchased this headset and POOF! My iphone didn't break and I'm saving thousands now! Thanks PYLE..drive.!
customer_reviews.author: Julius

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this. Started back with my swimming lately and usually spend an hour in the pool and this has been a revelation for me. I have sensitive ears when it comes to headphones but I can hardly feel this. So easy to load up music and use. Love it and a great price too.
customer_reviews.author: Sally

customer_reviews.title: JUNK, JUNK, JUUUUNK!!!
customer_reviews.text: I wore this junk three times and it quit working altogether, wouldn't boot up off the computer or anything, JUNK, JUNK, JUNK, SAVE YOUR MONEY!!! And lest you think I don't buy a lot, I have purchased over $25,000.00 from Amazon in the last four years. I know what I am talking about!!! JUNK, JUNK JUNK!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: BRIAN

customer_reviews.title: High-quality waterproof headsets for swimming
customer_reviews.text: Comes in a really nice package appears to be very high-quality, sounds great easy to put music on and if they keep the water out of my ears it’ll be amazing
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Good for swiming, basic MP3, good sound quality.
customer_reviews.text: Is a basic MP3 player that works pretty good for swiming. Plenty of storage space. Fits well and the gogles help to maintaining it in place. Controls are easy to access. There is no shuffle or random play options, so you would have to change the order of the songs in the computer and download them. Sound quality is good. Overall, is a MP3 that works as intended, good quality sound. Good for swiming.
customer_reviews.author: Judith Bou

customer_reviews.title: Can't wait to get off work and go swim laps now that these are delivered!
customer_reviews.text: Super excited. I can't stand swimming laps with no music. My husband has had these headphones for about 3 years and loves them. Excited to have my own set now!
customer_reviews.author: J. Wanderscheid

customer_reviews.title: Very nice player, but didn't last long.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Pyle PSWP6BK Flextreme Waterproof MP3 Player Headphones and loved them. I used them when gardening, swimming, traveling. They are so convenient and comfortable. I have tried many swimming/waterproof mp3 players and none have worked as well as Pyle. Others have included Diver, Finis Swimp3, Geronic. I just wish it didn't stop working within a year. I bought another one, not even thinking to try to get it replaced. The new one never worked. So now I will try to get them replaced by registering at the Pyle site. [I can load mp3s onto the device, and play them while the device is plugged into the laptop, but won't play when unplugged.]
customer_reviews.author: sseeger

customer_reviews.title: First of all the sound quality was no better than a $5 headphones
customer_reviews.text: Junk! First of all the sound quality was no better than a $5 headphones...Second, it has now stopped working or charging. Tried different ports but it still does not work! Total rubbish...and now if you want to claim warranty you have to include a check or money order for $15.00 for return shipping. They are making money off warranty too! I would steer my peeps away from this junk.
customer_reviews.author: FT86TT

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok. Not amazing.
customer_reviews.text: It works but the battery drains pretty quickly after the first few months of use. The Plastic earbud covers tend to fall off, and about 70% of the time only one or the other of the ear speakers will work underwater. Also if you have long hair or wear a swim cap you’ll struggle with the design. It’s better than nothing but I’m not super impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Ali

customer_reviews.title: It lasted 4 months then died
customer_reviews.text: I noticed since the beginning that when I used it outside of the water the sound was good, really high. But since I'm a swimmer when I got in the water, the sound farde a lot, so I had to put the volume on the highest since you can barely hear the music. The battery was ok, it lasted like 6 hours probably. Now after probably 4 months using it it finally died.
customer_reviews.author: Licario Zepeda

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after a few months.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this headset for the pool. It worked great at first but after a couple of months it won't even turn ON. Yes, I charged it but it still won't work. Spend a little more money on something that will last a lot longer. This product is NOT worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Palarin

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect, but pretty good
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Pyle MP3 player. I use it for swimming laps maybe 1-2 times a week. The first one lasted just shy of a year. For the price, it's the best product on the market. Sometimes my MacBook doesn't recognize it's plugged in, and it can be tricky to form a seal with my ears while swimming which affects the sound; but overall I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: S. Arnett

product_meta.title: Waterproof MP3 Player Swim Headphone Submersible IPX8 Flexible WrapAround Style Headphones Builtin Rechargeable Battery USB Connection w/ 4GB Flash Memory & Replacement Earbuds Pyle PSWP6BK
product_meta.description:
PyleSport Model : PSWP6BK

FLEXTREME WATERPROOF MP3 HEADPHONES
FLEXTREME WATERPROOF MP3 PLAYER WITH HEADPHONES
Features:Made to Fit: Bendable, Adjustable, FlexibleQuick Connect: Combination Charging & Data Transfer CableEasy 'Drag & Drop' Audio Music File ManagementSubmergible Waterproof Construction4 GB Integrated Flash Memory Builtin Rechargeable BatteryUniversal Size for All Head ShapesComfortable NonInterfering Headphones Flexible WrapAround Style Perfect for SportsUSB Port ConnectionSimple Touch Button ControlsIncludes Replacement EarbudsDesigned for Swimming, Running, Fitness, Exercise
What's in the Box:MP3 Player HeadphonesUSB Charge / Data Transfer Clip Cable(2) Pair WaterBlocking Earbuds (InWater Use)(3) Pair Active Sport Earbuds (OnLand Use)
Technical Specs:Marine Grade IPX8 Waterproof RatingDigital Audio File Support: MP3, WMABattery Charge Time: 2 HoursBattery Life: About 10 HoursLithium Battery: 200mAhSpeaker Type: NdFeB, 9mmSpeaker Rated Power: 5mWUSB 2.0 HighSpeed Data TransferFrequency Response: 20Hz 20kHzSignal Distortion: <0.1%S/N Ratio: >70dBWeight: 25 g
The Pyle Flextreme MP3 Sports Headphones provide you with waterproof sound & style Play all of your favorite songs with submergible marine grade construction. Builtin 4GB memory allows you to add hundreds of audio files right from your computer's music library. The flexible wraparound style is perfect for sports on land or in the water The 2in1 MP3 player plus headphone design features a builtin rechargeable battery, and the included USB connection charging cable keep the system wirefree. The comfortable & noninterfering wraparound design works great for your active lifestyle and slide on in seconds. Whether doing laps on the track, or in the swimming pool, the Pyle Flextreme will provide the sound for your sport
feature_bullets: Fully Submersible: WaterProof and durable (IPX8) the MP3 player and headphones are designed for long period use in water; Designed for sports like swimming, running, fitness, exercise and the like

Music File Management: Easy drag and drop files from iTunes for Mac or Windows and enjoy multi format playback with MP3 and WMA compatibility; Built in with up to 10 hours of battery life on one charge you'll never be caught out again

Flexible Non Interfering Headphone: Pyle’s flextreme mp3 player is universally sized bendable and adjustable for all head shapes; Wrap around style earphone are made to fit flexibly for your active lifestyle and slide on in seconds

4GB Flash Memory: Quick connect combination charging and data transfer cable that save hours of music; It has Simple touch control buttons; It also Includes 2 pair of water blocking earbuds in water use and 3 pair of active sport earbuds on land use

Benefits: Pyle 2 in 1 Mp3 with headphone has water blocking earbuds so, there is also no risk of water getting between the music and your inner ear; You can listen and scan to your favorite music underwater, no matter what the activity is
Please charge Fully before using, leave it charging overnight; Make sure that you didn't get water inside the charging port area

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.7 out of 5 stars1,193 ratings3.7 out of 5 stars
